executableContent.instructions: Create a variable named `favoriteIceCream` and assign it a string literal of `chocolate`.
Combine the string literals so that the `bestDessert` is equal to `vanilla ice cream`.

files.name: script.js

executableContent.instructions: Inside the `students` string and after the `:`, code an expression that adds all the school students' numbers. You'll want a string that displays like `# of Students: 260`.

files.name: script.js

executableContent.instructions: Code the `${color}` in the return line and call the function so that the message reads `Jerry always wears blue shirts.` . Pass the parameter without parenthesis.

files.name: script.js

executableContent.instructions: We planned a list of fabulous clothes and need to print it! Destructure the array and store its elements in the variables `top`, `bottom`, `outerwear`, and `footwear`. Keep the order inside `[]`. Then `console.log` each variable.

files.name: script.js

lessons.title: Code 2: The rest in Array Destructuring

executableContent.instructions: In this tea list, we find different flavors. We want to print a sentence about berry tea benefits, but we want to keep the remaining teas. Store `Berry` in the variable `berryTea` and the remaining teas in `otherTeas`. Then include the variable related to `Berry` in the first `console.log` and print the remaining teas in the second.

files.name: script.js

executableContent.instructions: In our neighbor's bakery, we have different types of bread. This time we need to choose the `Focaccia` to print an informative sentence that'll make this bread sell like hot cakes! Extract and store this value in the variable `italianBread`, then use it in the `console.log`.

files.name: script.js

executableContent.instructions: Flying is a fantastic adventure! Let's review some Boeing characteristics in this object. Destructure all its properties to use them in the `console.log`.

files.name: script.js

executableContent.instructions: We need to check the `smartTV` properties before going to the mall and buying a new one. When looking at the property names, the first two are too general to be useful; so let's change `type` for `screenType` and `shape` for `screenShape` in the object destructuring.

files.name: script.js

lessons.title: Code 6: The rest in Object destructuring

executableContent.instructions: We have an object with the best TV Shows per decade. We want to store the `eighties` property but keep the remaining properties in `otherOldShows`. Add these variables to object destructuring, and include `eighties` in the first `console.log`.

files.name: script.js

executableContent.instructions: The beer world is fascinating with all the different types and the considerable quantity we can find. We have an object with information about a specific beer. It's necessary to set a default value for the `brand` property because it is missing in `beer`. Set `"N/A"` as the default value for `brand` in the object destructuring. Then print `brand`.

files.name: script.js

executableContent.instructions: Destructure the first two items of `mountains` as parameters for  `getMountainsNickname`. Use the variable names `alps` and `logan`. Then, print them inside the function in the same order.
